interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/05/24 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['William Castle'], 'Producers': ['William Castle', 'Robb White'], 'Starring': ['Vincent Price', 'Richard Long', 'Carolyn Craid'], 'Studio': ['More to Explore']} Review Text: A teriffic old time scary haunted house story complete with clueless guests, skanky wife, possible infidelity, things that go bump in the night and the Master himself - Vincent Price. This is just classic, black & white, shivering in the dark perfection.

Guests invited to spend the night in a possibly haunted house for money are then terrorized throughout their experience. But by whom.., or what?

It may not be as nasty or clever or gory as movies that have come since then, but sit back and just enjoy a little creepy, old-time fun in the dark. Review Title: Scary good fun Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
G. Richard Jones (Actor), Blair Underwood (Actor), Christopher Scott Cherot (Director) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles ['Product Description', 'Richard T. Jones (Guess Who, TV\'s "The Wire"), Blair Underwood (Madea\'s Family Reunion, TV\'s "Fatherhood"), Chenoa Maxwell (Doing Hard Time, Hav Plenty), Andre Royo (Shaft, TV\'s "The Wire"), Andrew Lauren (Conspiracy Theory), Laz Alonzo (Jarhead, The Tenants) star in G, a tragedy-filled story of a young Great Gatsby-ish Hip-Hopper named Summer G who falls for a middle- to upper-class sistah while in college. After she rejects him for a fellow social climber, Summer G spends ten years building a Hip-Hop empire, and then moves to the Hamptons where he finds the object of his affections. Cinematic urban tastemaker movie which highlights an African-American aristocratic lifestyle.', 'Amazon.com', 'G.', 'is an engrossing update of', 'The Great Gatsby', ", set in the Hamptons and starring Richard T. Jones as Summer G., a self-made, millionaire head of a hip-hop label. Having risen from obscurity to make his fortune, Summer pines for just one thing: Sky (Chenoa Maxwell), the woman who dumped him back in college to marry the brutal, philandering Chip (Blair Underwood). Sky's feckless cousin, Tre (Andre Royer), a pop journalist, sets her up in an assignation with Summer, leading to predictable conflicts but with unexpected consequences. Co-written and directed by Christopher Scott Cherot,", 'G.', 'is also an interesting portrait of American wealth, particularly the collision of old and new money in the form of a biracial aristocracy coming to terms with a hip-hop elite. Strong performances alone are enough to recommend this feature.', '--Tom Keogh'] {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Dolby, Multiple Formats, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Judd Landon, Andrew Lauren Productions; G Productions, Chenoa Maxwell, Christopher Scott Cherot, Andrew Lauren, Blair Underwood, Richard JonesJudd Landon, Andrew Lauren Productions; G Productions, Chenoa Maxwell, Christopher Scott Cherot, Andrew Lauren, Blair Underwood, Richard Jones See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 36 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 4.75 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '043396143951', 'Director': 'Christopher Scott Cherot', 'Media Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Dolby, Multiple Formats, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 36 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 28, 2006', 'Actors': 'Richard Jones, Blair Underwood, Chenoa Maxwell', 'Subtitles': 'English, French', 'Producers': 'Andrew Lauren, Judd Landon', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} This is a movie to watch when you want to see a bunch of beautiful actors, in an even more beautiful setting, entertaining the audience with a very engaging love story. It is sexy, it is hip, and it is addicting.

My only and biggest complaint is that there is no place to find the music soundtrack. In fact, it is the main reason why I bought this DVD. Haunting and gorgous, I just wish it was available somewhere. Guilty Pleasure Spirited Away Hayao Miyazaki (Director) Rated: PG Format: DVD Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Animation ['Product Description', 'From one of the most celebrated filmmakers in the history of animated cinema comes the most acclaimed film of 2002. Hayao Miyazaki\'s latest triumph, filled with astonishing animation and epic adventure, is a dazzling masterpiece for the ages. It\'s a "wonderfully welcoming work of art that\'s as funny and entertaining as it is brilliant, beautiful, and deep" (Joe Morgenstern, Wall Street Journal). SPIRITED AWAY is a wondrous fantasy about a young girl, Chihiro, trapped in a strange new world of spirits. When her parents undergo a mysterious transformation, she must call upon the courage she never knew she had to free herself and return her family to the outside world. An unforgettable story brimming with creativity, SPIRITED AWAY will take you on a journey beyond your imagination. "To enter the world of Hayao Miyazaki is to experience a kind of lighthearted enchantment that is unique to the world of animation" (Roger Ebert, Chicago Sun-Times). It\'s a fantastic tale the whole family will want to experience over and over again.~~(c) 2001 Nibariki -- GNDDTM', 'Set Contains:', 'The most interesting extra feature on the two-disc set is the Nippon Television Special on the making of', 'Spirited Away', ', not because it\'s significantly different from American making-of programs, but because the camera crew was allowed to film Miyazaki at work. It\'s fascinating to watch the visionary director explaining how individual movements should be animated, and even performing the little dance the frog-master does to welcome the No-Face to Yubaba\'s bath house. (Old animators describe Walt Disney giving similar performances, but no comparable footage exists.) It\'s also striking to see how intimate Studio Ghibli is, unencumbered by the tiers of management that burden American studios. The scene comparisons enable the viewer to study the storyboards for the film, which Miyazaki draws himself. These simple yet wonderfully vivid images capture the essence of a mood, a movement, an expression. "Behind the Microphone" offers a fairly standard behind-the-scenes look at the creation of the excellent English version of', 'Spirited Away', '.', '--Charles Solomon'] {'Genre': 'Fantasy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Hayao Miyazaki', 'Language': 'French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), Japanese (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 5 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.57 x 5.3 x 7.52 inches; 4.32 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'UPC# 7869 3621 3843', 'Director': 'Hayao Miyazaki', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 5 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 15, 2003', 'Studio': 'Walt Disney Home Entertainment Presents A Studio Ghibli Film', 'Number of discs': '1'} To try and describe this movie is kind of crazy. I mean there's this little girl in a world inhabited by strange and curious spirits who must rescue her parents from a frightening and terrible fate. But the journey is so much more than a simple description.

The animation is just gorgeous, the story is captivating and unique, and the musical score is so haunting and beautiful, you will find yourself remembering the themes long after the movie is over. Please give it a chance and allow yourself to be swept away by this special little film. A beautiful, thoughtful experience Code Name: Dancer [DVD] Kate Capshaw (Actor), Jeroen Krabb (Actor), Buzz Kulik (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Action & Adventure {'Format': 'Color, DVD, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Tracey Williams, Al Sapienza, Kate Capshaw, Cliff De Young, Corinne Bohrer, Helen Siff, Buzz Kulik, Jorge Martnez de Hoyos, Garette Ratliff Henson, Krzyztof Waliszewski, Kimberly Kulik, Honorato Magaloni, Jeroen Krabb, James Sloyan, Kurt Braunreiter, Jill Wagner-Porter, Robin Hudis, Andaluz Russell, Francisco Cuevas, Hilary Perez, Guillermo Ros, Valerie Mahaffey, Gregory SierraTracey Williams, Al Sapienza, Kate Capshaw, Cliff De Young, Corinne Bohrer, Helen Siff, Buzz Kulik, Jorge Martnez de Hoyos, Garette Ratliff Henson, Krzyztof Waliszewski, Kimberly Kulik, Honorato Magaloni, Jeroen Krabb, James Sloyan, Kurt Braunreiter, Jill Wagner-Porter, Robi… See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 34 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 4.16 Ounces', 'Director': 'Buzz Kulik', 'Media Format': 'Color, DVD, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 34 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 4, 2004', 'Actors': 'Kate Capshaw, Jeroen Krabb, Gregory Sierra, Valerie Mahaffey, James Sloyan', 'Studio': 'Trinity Home Ent', 'Number of discs': '1'} I, like others have written, only saw this movie once many years back - but it stuck with me. It's never been re- broadcast that I could tell and I just figured for the price why not buy it.

There was nothing on tv worth watching so we popped the film in and had a really enjoyable time watching it. In fact it is eons better than some of the garbage currently on.

Great love story, top notch actors and a pretty decent story. For a couple of hours I escaped into a very pleasant movie.

If anyone out there has any influence, please get some network to give this film some air time. If even if its just on the Lifetime channel. I'm certain the viewers would love it. Fun movie - even if a tad bit dated HOME ALONE 2: LOST IN NEW YORK Macaulay Culkin (Actor), Joe Pesci (Actor), Chris Columbus (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, Kids & Family, Family Features ['Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern. The bad guys get it, and the little kid gives it to them-only this time in the colorful setting of New York City. 1992/color/102 min/PG/widescreen.'] {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': "Maureen Elisabeth Shay, Kieran Culkin, Anna Slotky, Tim Curry, Dana Ivey, Catherine O'Hara, Jedidiah Cohen, Daniel Stern, John Heard, Senta Moses, Brenda Fricker, Devin Ratray, Michael C. Maronna, Terrie Snell, Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Hillary Wolf, Daiana Campeanu, Eddie Bracken, Gerry Bamman, Chris ColumbusMaureen Elisabeth Shay, Kieran Culkin, Anna Slotky, Tim Curry, Dana Ivey, Catherine O'Hara, Jedidiah Cohen, Daniel Stern, John Heard, Senta Moses, Brenda Fricker, Devin Ratray, Michael C. Maronna, Terrie Snell, Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Hillary Wolf, Daiana Campeanu, Eddie B… See more", 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Runtime': '2 hours', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.56 x 5.3 x 7.53 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'FOXS2289224DVD', 'Director': 'Chris Columbus', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '2 hours', 'Release date': 'October 5, 1999', 'Actors': 'Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern, John Heard, Devin Ratray', 'Studio': 'TWENTIETH CENTURY FOX', 'Number of discs': '1'} The real reason why I wanted this film has everything to do with the ending. I know that seems weird but as a native New Yorker, I just love the scenes between a mom and her son in front of the most spectacular Christmas Tree in the world. So, there it is.

The movie isn't particularly bad or good. Pretty much the same formula as the first movie with just a few more predictable changes. But I don't mind sitting through it and going along for the ride. I could do far worse. Guilty Pleasure - okay movie Jane Fonda: AM/PM Yoga For Beginners [DVD] Jane Fonda (Actor), Cal Pozo (Director) Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Exercise & Fitness ['Jane Fonda is back again with yoga designed for baby boomers! Build strength, improve flexibility and relax the body with AM/PM YOGA FOR BEGINNERS.'] {'Color': 'Multicoloured', 'Brand': 'LIONSGATE', 'Product Care Instructions': 'Hand Wash Only', 'Item Weight': '0.14 Pounds', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.24 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '10309110', 'Director': 'Cal Pozo', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 11 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 4, 2012', 'Actors': 'Jane Fonda', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Number of discs': '1'} I bought this for a good friend as a New Year's resolution kind of gift. She was interested in yoga but didn't want to make a huge investment until she knew what it was all about. Apparently she is very happy with the program and the instructions. She says that you don't feel a lot of pressure and the pace is perfect for a person who hasn't exercised a lot in their life and wants to gradually get into it. Makes sense to me and if she's happy - then I'm happy for her. Seems to be okay {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['John Singleton'], 'Producers': ['Jane Bartelme', 'Jeremy Bell', 'Patrick Crowley', 'Doug Davison', 'Ellen Goldsmith-Vein', 'Wolfgang Hammer', 'Anthony Katagas', 'Dan Lautner', 'Roy Lee'], 'Starring': ['Taylor Lautner', 'Lily Collins', 'Alfred Molina'], 'Studio': ['IMDB Freedive']} Even though I found this movie to be somewhat predictable, sometimes it's just fun to let go and enjoy the ride.

The acting is very good, the action and conflict are intense and the film moves along at a quick pace. The story is basically an updated version of the whole "boy on the milk carton" scenario, revised as the "boy on the website". Clever and plausible.

Need something to watch when you're out of options - this film is a good choice for some fueled up energy and an entertaining night at the movies. Keeps your attention - entertaining {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Robson', 'Mark'], 'Producers': ['David Weisbart'], 'Starring': ['Barbara Parkins', 'Patty Duke', 'Paul Burke'], 'Studio': ['Crowd Pleasers']} Every now & then I just feel like watching something totally mindless and brain dead (not me, the movie!) and this perfectly fits the bill.

The story, the setting, the horrific attempts at acting and the complete unavailability of some type of cohesive editing make this film the ideal candidate for those rainy days when Lifetime Channel is showing something you've seen one too many times. In fact, it's more like horrific success at over-acting that leaves me mesmerized.

Don't worry too much about the story of three young women of the 60's trying to succeed in modeling, film, broadway and love. Just sit back with a chilled bottle of wine, some crackers & cheese, and a couple of hours to give yourself a break and have a totally entertaining afternoon at "camp". Total camp, terrible acting - love it! {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Joseph Sargent'], 'Producers': ['Synergy Ent'], 'Starring': ['Sally Field', 'Eleanor Parker', 'Lane Bradbury'], 'Studio': ['The Film Detective']} I hadn't seen this movie since the 70's when it was an "ABC Movie of the Week", but it always stayed in my mind.

The story of youth wanting to run away from the constraints of misguided adults is as old as time. And although the clothes, characters, music and some of the dialogue is a little dated, the feelings are the same. Generational breakdown in communication pure & simple. Everyone has wanted to run away & join the circus at some point in their life.

The acting is what actually sets this film apart from many of that period. A very young Sally Fields, Jackie Cooper, Eleanor Parker, and a sadly under-used David Carradine (pre "Kung Fu") elevate this film.

I think its worth watching & especially since Amazon offers it for free with your Prime membership. A whole lot better than most of the garbage out there right now. Worth the trip down Memory Lane {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['William Castle'], 'Producers': ['William Castle', 'Robb White'], 'Starring': ['Vincent Price', 'Richard Long', 'Carolyn Craid'], 'Studio': ['More to Explore']} A teriffic old time scary haunted house story complete with clueless guests, skanky wife, possible infidelity, things that go bump in the night and the Master himself - Vincent Price. This is just classic, black & white, shivering in the dark perfection.

Guests invited to spend the night in a possibly haunted house for money are then terrorized throughout their experience. But by whom.., or what?

It may not be as nasty or clever or gory as movies that have come since then, but sit back and just enjoy a little creepy, old-time fun in the dark. Scary good fun
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary**

- **Media Type Preference**: The user continues to enjoy movies, especially drama and romance, while maintaining an interest in animated films with fantasy elements and emotional depth. They show a growing appreciation for classic horror films that combine nostalgia with entertainment.

- **Cinematic Interests**: They favor urban themes and narratives reflecting African-American experiences, alongside a new affinity for vintage horror stories, especially those featuring strong performances and classic aesthetics.

- **Emotional Engagement**: The user seeks films that evoke strong emotional responses and engages with both heartwarming family tales and nostalgic horror narratives that capture universal themes of fear and excitement, enhancing their appreciation for storytelling that evokes youthful escapism.

- **Aesthetic Appreciation**: They consistently express interest in the visual and auditory elements of cinema, enjoying the captivating performances and striking visuals found in both animated and classic films.

- **Soundtrack Importance**: The user acknowledges the role of music in elevating emotional narratives, which strengthens their engagement with various film experiences.

- **Rating and Purchase Behavior**: They often rate films highly based on quality and enjoyment, recently demonstrating a fondness for classic films, including horror and drama, that focus on compelling storytelling and emotional catharsis. This reflects a balanced media consumption approach, valuing the ability of diverse genres to create memorable experiences.

In summary, the user enjoys a mix of aesthetically-driven, emotionally engaging storytelling across genres, finding resonance in both nostalgic family moments and classic spooky adventures.
